result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demetrius Malik Demus

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demetrius Malik Demus appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Demetrius Malik Demus.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 11/9/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Received and Filed. STATES MOTION IN LIMINE
Received and Filed. STATES WITNESS LIST
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed.

Defendant Demetrius Malik Demus appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Demetrius Malik Demus.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Demetrius Malik Demus in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel, received and filed.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CED.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Demetrius Malik Demus in court with attorney Jane Jerman.  Defendant Demetrius Malik Demus in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demetrius Malik Demus appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to the intake calendar of the week, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
